properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 30 at 5:32PM MST until January 30 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming...

* Until 615 PM MST.

* At 532 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from near Iron Mountain to 6 miles southwest of Burns,
moving south at 35 mph.

HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and
blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar and webcams.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

This includes the following highways...
Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 41.
Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 338 and 402.

Locations impacted include...
Cheyenne, Pine Bluffs, Burns, South Greeley, Hillsdale, Federal,
Crystal Lake Reservoir, Crystal Lake Campground, Granite Springs
Reservoir, Iron Mountain, Ranchettes, Granite Springs Campground,
Warren AFB, Frontier Park, North Cheyenne, Whitaker, Horse Creek,
Warren Af Base, Carpenter and Fox Farm-College.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits.
Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions,
making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped
vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow
squall arrives.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 6:15 PM MST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
